intro: Hieracium laurinum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with a single row of ray florets surrounding a central cluster of tubular flowers. Hieracium laurinum is often found in meadows, pastures, and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils.
